intro: Callianthemoides, commonly known as the rock garlic or rock starflower, is a member of the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Western Asia. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are adapted to survive in harsh, well-drained soils. Callianthemoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
